intro: Hippomarathrum longilobum, commonly known as the long-lobed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped with serrated edges, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
